text:
(1)
East River, south from East 85th Street, showing the southern tip of Carl Schurz Park and three fashionable apartment houses, Nos. 12-10, 7, and 1, respectively, Gracie Square (East 84th Street) south side, from the river to East End Ave. Also shown (left) is the power house of the Interborough Rapid Transit Co., and faintly New York Hospital and Cornell Medical College. A portion of Welfare Island is visible on the extreme left. The point of vantage is the Astoria Ferry in midstream.
March 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a more limited view (to East 80th Street), showing prominently the plant of the Yorkville Ice Sales Corp. at the foot of East 82nd street. The vantage point is Welfare Island.
April 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, viewed in the opposite direction (northward), showing (left) John Jay Park, from East 76th to East 78th Streets and (right) a portion of the western edge of Welfare Island; the point of vantage.
April 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan from East 85th Street - Queensborough Bridge - [Interboro Rapid Transit Building; New York Hospital; Yorkville Ice Sales Corporation.]

title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan from East 85th Street - Queensborough Bridge - [Interboro Rapid Transit Building; New York Hospital; Yorkville Ice Sales Corporation.]

text:
(1)
East River, from East 85th (left) to East 92nd Streets, showing prominently (left to right) the 17-story apartment house, No. 120 East End Ave., at the N.E. corner of East 85th Street; 130 East End Ave., at the N.W. corner of East 86th Street; Doctor's Hospital from East 87th to East 88th Streets; all facing on Carl Schurz Park. On the extreme right is visible the Municipal Asphalt plant, from East 90th to East 91st Streets. The point of vantage is the Astoria Ferry in midstream.
March 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date and showing a slightly limited view (to East 89th Street). The point of vantage is Welfare Island.
April 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, from Gracie Square (East 84th Street) to East 88th Street. On the extreme left is shown a portion of No. 10-12 Gracie Square, and slightly north of it, Miss Chapin's School, at the N.E. corner of East End Ave., and East 84th Street facing Carl Schurz Park. The vantage point is Welfare Island.
April 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan between East 85th and 92nd Streets - Queensborough Bridge - [Doctor's Hospital - Municipal Asphalt Plant - Miss Chapin's School.]

text:
543 East 85th Street, at the N.W. corner of East End Ave., as seen across Carl Shurz Park.

September 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
